org.easetech.easytest.converter

Interface ParamAwareConverter<Type>

  • Type Parameters:
    Type - the type of object to convert to from a map.
    All Superinterfaces:
    BaseConverter<Map<String,Object>,Type>, Converter<Type>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConverter

    public interface ParamAwareConverter<Type>
extends Converter<Type>
    Decorator of Converter to provide the name of the parameter to the implementing class. Users who are extending from AbstractConverter will have no effect on their existing converters. On top of that they will now have access to the parameter name using the AbstractConverter.getParamName() method. Users who are directly implementing Converter interface will have to switch to either ParamAwareConverter or AbstractConverter to get the parameter name.
    Author:
    Anuj Kumar

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.easetech.easytest.converter.BaseConverter

        COLON, EMPTY_STRING

      Type convert(Map<String,Object> convertFrom, String paramName)
      Convert the Map into a user defined object and also expect the param name

      • Methods inherited from interface org.easetech.easytest.converter.Converter

        convert, convertTo, instanceOfType

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        Type convert(Map<String,Object> convertFrom,
           String paramName)
        Convert the Map into a user defined object and also expect the param name
        Parameters:
        convertFrom - the Map to convert from
        paramName - the name of the parameter for which this converter is called
        Returns:
        the object to convert to identified by Converter.convertTo() class.
